content:
ListBoxItem Class

Definition

Represents an item in a ListBox or ComboBox control in an application that was upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class ListBoxItem
Inheritance
System.Object
ListBoxItem

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

In Visual Basic 6.0, the ListBox and ComboBox controls use a List property to store list items and an ItemData property to optionally store an Integer associated with each list item. In Visual Basic, the ListBox and ComboBox controls use the Items property to store list items, and the ItemData property is no longer supported.

When a Visual Basic 6.0 application is upgraded to Visual Basic, the upgrade tools create a ListBoxItem class for each item in a ListBox or ComboBox control. The SetItemData and GetItemData functions can then be used to enable any code that references the ItemData property.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

String

A String that contains the list item.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. Initializes an instance of the ListBoxItem class.

public ListBoxItem (string ItemString, int ItemData);

String

A String that contains the list item.

ItemData
Int32

An Integer that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 ItemData value.

Remarks

When a Visual Basic 6.0 application is upgraded to Visual Basic, the upgrade tools create a ListBoxItem class for each item in a ListBox or ComboBox control. The SetItemData and GetItemData functions can then be used to enable any code that references the ItemData property.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Fields

ItemData

Stores the ItemData value for an item in a ListBox or ComboBox control in an application that was upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

public int ItemData;

Remarks

When a Visual Basic 6.0 application is upgraded to Visual Basic, the upgrade tools create a ListBoxItem class for each item in a ListBox or ComboBox control. The SetItemData and GetItemData functions can then be used to enable any code that references the ItemData property.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ItemString

Stores the List value for an item in a ListBox or ComboBox control in an application that was upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

public string ItemString;

Remarks

When a Visual Basic 6.0 application is upgraded to Visual Basic, the upgrade tools create a ListBoxItem class for each item in a ListBox or ComboBox control. The SetItemData and GetItemData functions can then be used to enable any code that references the ItemData property.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. Methods

ToString()

Converts a ListBoxItem to a String.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A String that contains the value of the ListBoxItem.

Remarks

A ListBoxItem cannot be converted to a String; you must call the ToString method to convert the type.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
